1.caption: 2018 Major League Baseball Home Run Derby
1.description: The 2018 Major League Baseball Home Run Derby was a home run hitting contest between eight batters from Major League Baseball (MLB). The derby was held on July 16, 2018, at Nationals Park in Washington, D.C., the site of the 2018 MLB All-Star Game. On July 11, the participants were announced. Bryce Harper was the winner, as he beat Kyle Schwarber, in the final 19–18, winning the derby in front of his hometown crowd. He tied Schwarber on the last pitch as time expired in regulation; then won it with 16 seconds left in bonus time.

2.caption: 2018 Major League Baseball All-Star Game
2.description: The 2018 Major League Baseball All-Star Game was the 89th Major League Baseball All-Star Game. The game was hosted by the Washington Nationals and was played at Nationals Park on July 17, 2018. It was televised nationally by Fox. The American League beat the National League 8–6, in 10 innings.
2.inspected:TV announcers: Joe Buck, John Smoltz, Ken Rosenthal and Tom Verducci (Fox)Dan Shulman and Buck Martinez (MLB International)
2.inspected:Television: Fox (United States)MLB International (outside of the United States)
